sentence: The Procter & Gamble CompanyPG is set to report fourth-quarter and fiscal 2015 results on Jul 30, before the market opens.
Last quarter, the company delivered in-line results.
Let's see how things are shaping up for this announcement.

Slowing global market growth, strong currency headwinds, market level challenges in the Ukraine, Russia and the Middle East, Venezuela, Argentina and Hong Kong and rising commodity costs have made P&G's operating environment challenging, hampering its growth.

The company is struggling to grow sales due to significant negative Fx impact, market share erosion and lower consumption in several countries due to pricing action, and macroeconomic headwinds in many key markets.
However, management expects fourth-quarter results to be better than the first three quarters of the fiscal year.
Earnings are expected to benefit from higher pricing, productivity savings and lower oil-based commodity costs.
Management expects pricing to contribute significantly to sales growth in the to-be-reported quarter which should offset the resultant volume erosion.
However, negative Fx impact and brand-building investments will keep profits under pressure.
Management expects stronger margin expansion in the fourth quarter than the third.
Our proven model does not conclusively show that P&G is likely to beat earnings this quarter.
That is because a stock needs to have both a positive Earnings ESP and a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), 2 (Buy) or 3 (Hold) for this to happen.
That is not the case here, as you will see below.
Zacks ESP: The Earnings ESP for P&G is -1.06% as the Most Accurate estimate stands at 93 cents, lower than the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 94 cents.
Zacks Rank: P&G's Zacks Rank #3 increases the predictive power of ESP.
However, we need to have a positive ESP to be confident about an earnings surprise.
We caution against stocks with a Zacks Rank #4 or 5 (Sell-rated stocks) going into the earnings announcement, especially when the company is seeing negative estimate revisions momentum.

Some stocks in the broader consumer staples sector that have both a positive Earnings ESP and a favorable Zacks Rank are:

Dean Foods Company DF , with an Earnings ESP of +3.85% and a Zacks Rank #1.
Campbell Soup Company CPB , with an Earnings ESP of +7.50% and a Zacks Rank #1.
The J. M. Smucker Company SJM , with an Earnings ESP of +2.46% and a Zacks Rank #3.
